result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Pelzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
AODA assessment and follow through.  Absolute sobriety.

Conditions:  Absolute sobriety; no possession of alcohol, no class B establishments, cooperate with any recommended treatment by agent.
from Golden House / request to modify and/or remove the No Contact condition of bond;  Court's note to accept and removes no contact condition.

Defendant Bradley M Pelzman in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Victim is present and wants contact.  Court questions her.  DA reads defendant's prior record.  Court will require a Safte Haven safety plan.  Upon receipt of the notice, Court will drop the no contact order.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley M Pelzman in court, in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advises the Court regarding his next meeting with his Parole Agent to determine whether he will be released from his hold or remain in custody.  Court continues this matter to determine if defendant will be released to attempt to hire counsel and return to work.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
no contact with victim D.B. absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no Class B establishments cooperate with any recommended treatment by agent
No contact with victim, DB. Absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol.  No class B licensed establishments.  Co-operate with any recommended treatment by agent.

Defendant Bradley M Pelzman appeared by video means with Atty Haacke.   Prosecuting Atty Gregory A. Parker appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case was carried over from yesterday.  Agent has a hold on him as well.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bradley M Pelzman appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Gregory A. Parker appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Has not filled out forms to see if he qualifies for the Public Defender services.  Right to an attorney explained.  Judge feels defendant should have an attorney or at least speak with one and see if he qualifies, etc.  No bond set today.  Community Programs or Human Services should also be talking with him, this afternoon.  Hold over til tomorrow.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
